intro: Epistephium macrophyllum, commonly known as the giant water lily, is a striking aquatic plant native to the Amazon Basin. It is characterized by its large, broad leaves that can reach up to 3 meters in diameter, providing a unique habitat for various aquatic life forms. The plant has a robust root system that anchors it in the muddy substrate of slow-moving or still water bodies. Its flowers are typically white or pink, blooming at night and emitting a mild fragrance to attract pollinators. Epistephium macrophyllum plays an important ecological role in maintaining water quality and supporting biodiversity in its native environment.
